[h1] Black Mesa incident from Barneys point of view [/h1]
Just as in Opposing Force, but this time you play as Barney Calhoun and get to see how he escaped the facility. I found this more interesting than Opposing Force, even though it's 2 times shorter.

Blue Shift è la seconda e ultima espansione del meraviglioso mondo di Half-Life. Di breve durata e sicuramente meno entusiasmante di Opposing Force, va a riproporre ambienti di gioco, armi, nemici e gameplay del titolo principale senza nessuna novità degna di nota. Unica eccezione, la narrazione dal punto di vista del buon Barney Calhoun, che ritroveremo poi all'inizio del secondo capitolo. Unica vera pecca a mio avviso, l'assenza del doppiaggio italiano. Ma nonostante ciò tornare a Black Mesa fa sempre piacere, quindi mi sento di consigliare Blue Shift a tutti gli amanti della serie.

Right after having finished Opposing Force i started Blue Shift and finished it in one sitting, not because i couldn't put it down but rather that it was short and sweet and didn't realize how short it actually was.
I'm just going to keep this review short because basically if you enjoyed Half-Life or Opposing Force then you're going to like this.

Pros:
+  Inside the prologue there's quite a few little stories between NPC's wich made it feel more lively.
+ A third and last perspective of the Black Mesa incident.

Cons:
- Doesn't add anything new like Opposing Force did.

Summary:
Half-Life: Blue Shift is a short and sweet game, while not as good as the main one or Opposing force, it still is fun to play through and for sure worth 1-2 hours of your time. Also for a 4€ price tag you can't really complain about it other than the lenght so for most people i'd say just buy the bundle.
